raw_stats_gf: the oldest sample (La Cougourlude, 510â€“475 bce) shows some of the highest levels of wild ancestry (~45%), whereas other early samples from Mas de Vignoles XIV (second to first century bce) have marginal amounts of wild ancestry (3.5â€“4.5%), and five samples from La Lesse-Espagnac (175â€“225 ce) range from ~10% to 38%.  these results suggest that the local wild gene pool played an early role for domesticated varieties, with the gene flow between wild grapevines and domesticated cultivars occurring at least 2,500 years ago

File.Name: 10.1093_molbev_msae128.pdf
method_of_estimating_gf: minor allele frequency, Watterson's theta, pairwise Fst
raw_stats_gf: (In doc) Lines represent predicted FST values based on nonlinear regression (FST = ab1/âˆ‚t) as used in Bergland et al. (2014) with 95% confidence intervals in gray. The line for the more isolated ponds (top 50% isolated) is lower than for the less isolated ponds (bottom 50% isolated), indicating less pronounced changes in observed allele frequencies, possibly due to lower local âˆ’ âˆ’ âˆ’ gene flow. In contrast to the overall pattern of a decline of median MAF over time, this median increased in some of the subpopulations over time, alongside with rapid and strong genomic differentiation and an increase in the number of heterozygous sites. We interpret these observations as gene flow plus hybrid vigor events.

increase_decrease_ep: decrease; potenial for slight expansion in Bay Area, compared 3 populations and models from historic and moden samples, varying patterns
raw_stats_nd: change in pi  from historic to now across pops: -0.0000102, -0.0000582, -0.0000207, 3.9E-06, 0.0000138
notes_nd: also calculated watterson's theta; data extracted from fig. s5 with web plot digitizer focusing on subsampled comparison
hypothesized_driver_of_change_ps: coastal habitat loss; urbanization, agriculture, and mining; anthropogenic
raw_stats_gf: temporal variation in population structure, with modern birds from the central and northern California	coast	exhibiting	a	17%	(Morro	Bay)	to	64%	(Humboldt	Bay)	increase in the proportion of ancestry shared with inland eastern California birds. These temporal changes point to a recent increase in the level of gene flow from inland eastern California populations into coastal populations.
central_question_regarding_selection_sel: Do alleles associated with local adaptation to tidal marshes resist gene flow from inland populations? / does selection prevent gene flow?
selection_hypothesized_driver_of_change_: gene flow resulting from urbanization; anthropogenic
selection_method_of_estimating_selection: test for correlation between historical deviation in allele frequency and change in allele frequency through time for each SNP
raw_stats_drift: found gene flow more likely driver of results than drift
hypothesized_diver_of_change_fst: coastal habitat loss; urbanization, agriculture, and mining; anthropogenic
authors_paperinfo: Benham; Phred M.; Walsh; Jennifer; Bowie; Rauri C. K.
Title_paperinfo: Spatial variation in population genomic responses to over a century of anthropogenic change within a tidal marsh songbird

File.Name: 10.1111_mec.16111.pdf

raw_stats_gf: assume a mutation rate of 2.9 Ã— 10âˆ’9 (from the butterfly Heliconius melpomene; Keightley et al., 2015) and Ï€ = 0.0092 (our mean estimate), diversity levels suggest a global, long- term effective population size of ~793,000. This is ~4500 times greater than the average variance effective population size we estimated and thus would require ~4500 populations of this size connected by gene flow

Title_paperinfo: Genomic time-series data show that gene flow maintains high genetic diversity despite substantial genetic drift in a butterfly species

File.Name: 10.1111_mec.16933.pdf
method_of_estimating_gf: Proportion of wild genome computed via STRUCTURE
raw_stats_gf: The salmon population in the river Etne has been subject to introgression from domesticated salmon escaping from commercial fish farms, with an average 24%	of	genetic	admixture	in	the	contemporary	population. When	predicting	age	at	maturation	from	the	joined	effect	of	admixture and genotype, no interaction was detected between individual admixture and vgll3 genotype (Ï‡2â€‰=â€‰3.6,	dfâ€‰=â€‰2,	pâ€‰=â€‰.161),	nor	between individual admixture and six6 genotype (Ï‡2â€‰=â€‰2.7,	dfâ€‰=â€‰2,	pâ€‰=â€‰.24),	indicating	that	the	temporal	dissociation	between	these	loci	and age at maturation was independent from individual admixture.

File.Name: 10.1111_mec.17274.pdf
method.of.estimating_ep: mean per-site Watterson's theta estimator, Kumar and Subramanian 2002
raw_stats_nd: pre-hunting period: 3.34 10 -4; during hunting 3.35 10^-4; post hunting 3.23 10^-4
raw_stats_ps: see doc. "The assignment of modern groups to estimate genetic clusters strongly correlates with geography, while ancient groups do not."
raw_stats_gf: (Fig in doc) the spatiotemporal groups of ancient individuals are not strongly distinct from one another in the admixture analysis .
